column3: Looks good.\nI just started a gitian build. Will be done within ~10mins. https://builds.jonasschnelli.ch/pulls/5790/\n
As this is just a change to the gitian descriptors (and just the packaging in that), I suppose it doesn't necessitate another rc. In that case ACK for 0.10.\n
Mustn't gitian-osx-signer.yml (or detached-sig-apply.sh) also be changed for this change in structure?\n

No, see the PR comment. sig creation is all relative to the working dir, and I've been meaning to make it extract to a subdir rather than polluting the current dir anyway. sig application is impartial, as it's also relative to the working dir.\n
Actually, hold on that for a sec. On second thought you might be right.\n

@laanwj My apologies, this does end up breaking the signing process. I'll revert that change since it's only needed for signing. We can do the cleanups post-0.10.

Thanks for catching it.
